com.flir.thermalsdk.image.measurements

Class MeasurementCircle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flir.thermalsdk.image.measurements.MeasurementShape
      • com.flir.thermalsdk.image.measurements.MeasurementCircle

  • public class MeasurementCircle
extends MeasurementShape
    Defines the circle measurement tool shape. Circle is described by a surrounding rectangle. This tool allows to measure temperature in circle area. It gives the possibility to find area's minimum, maximum and average temperature. There is functionality to find the exact location for minimum and maximum values.
    Below is an example, how to read and modify the collection containing circle measurement tools. 
     public class MyMeasurements {
 
    
 private ThermalImage mImage;
 
    
 // ... load the image from file or FLIR Thermal camera
 
    
 public void getCircleMeasurements() {
 MeasurementShapeCollection collection = mImage.getMeasurements();
 List<MeasurementCircle> circles = collection.getCircles();
 // use circles
 }
 
    
 public void addCircleMeasurement(int left, int top, int radius) {
 try {
 mImage.getMeasurements().addCircle(left, top, radius);
 } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
 // invalid shape coordinates
 }
 }
 }
    `

    • Method Detail

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(Point point)
            throws MeasurementException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Moves the shape to the desired position. Note that the point corresponds to an circle geometric center.
        Specified by:
        moveTo in class MeasurementShape
        Parameters:
        point - A point where the shape should be moved to. Note that the point corresponds to an circle geometric center.
        Throws:
        MeasurementException - when the shape is invalid (i.e. removed from measurements collection)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when moving to given point causes the shape to be out of image bound (i.e. moving to negative coordinates)

      • getColdSpot

        public Point getColdSpot()
        Gets the position of the cold spot on the image. The cold spot indicates the place in the rectangle, where the measured temperature is the lowest. The value of this temperature is returned from getMin() method.
        Returns:
        the position of the cold spot on the image within this rectangle measurement tool.

      • isColdSpotMarkerVisible

        public boolean isColdSpotMarkerVisible()
        Checks, if cold spot marker is visible on the image. The cold spot indicates the place in the rectangle, where the measured temperature is the lowest. The value of this temperature is returned from getMin() method.
        Returns:
        true, if the cold spot is displayed on the image, false otherwise.

      • setColdSpotMarkerVisible

        public void setColdSpotMarkerVisible(boolean visible)
                              throws MeasurementException
        Sets the flag, if cold spot marker should be displayed on the image and its temperature should be calculated.
        Parameters:
        visible - true, if the cold spot should be displayed on the image, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        MeasurementException - when the shape is invalid (i.e. removed from measurements collection)

      • isColdSpotEnabled

        public boolean isColdSpotEnabled()
        Cold spot is enabled. The cold spot value should be displayed in the result table as seen in the camera overlay.
        Returns:
        Returns true is cold spot is enabled, otherwise false.

      • getHotSpot

        public Point getHotSpot()
        Gets the position of the hot spot on the image. The hot spot indicates the place in the rectangle, where the measured temperature is the highest. The value of this temperature is returned from getMax() method.
        Returns:
        the position of the hot spot on the image within this rectangle measurement tool.

      • isHotSpotMarkerVisible

        public boolean isHotSpotMarkerVisible()
        Checks, if hot spot marker is visible on the image. The hot spot indicates the place in the rectangle, where the measured temperature is the highest. The value of this temperature is returned from getMax() method.
        Returns:
        true, if the hot spot is displayed on the image, false otherwise.

      • setHotSpotMarkerVisible

        public void setHotSpotMarkerVisible(boolean visible)
                             throws MeasurementException
        Sets the flag, if hot spot marker should be displayed on the image and its temperature should be calculated.
        Parameters:
        visible - true, if the hot spot should be displayed on the image, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        MeasurementException - when the shape is invalid (i.e. removed from measurements collection)

      • isHotSpotEnabled

        public boolean isHotSpotEnabled()
        Hot spot is enabled. The hot spot value should be displayed in the result table as seen in the camera overlay.
        Returns:
        Returns true is hot spot is enabled, otherwise false.

      • getAverage

        public ThermalValue getAverage()
        Gets the ThermalValue read by rectangle measurement tools. This value describes the average temperature from the area covered by the rectangle tool.
        Returns:
        the temperature measured by tool.

      • getMin

        public ThermalValue getMin()
        Gets the ThermalValue read by rectangle measurement tools. This value describes the minimum temperature measured by the rectangle tool. The value is calculated in the same way as for MeasurementSpot.
        Returns:
        the temperature measured by tool.

      • getMax

        public ThermalValue getMax()
        Gets the ThermalValue read by rectangle measurement tools. This value describes the maximum temperature measured by the tool. The value is calculated in the same way as for MeasurementSpot.
        Returns:
        the temperature measured by tool.
